security: Disclosing Leonov’s KGB affiliation and activities could compromise intelligence operations, specifically naming Leonov as being involved in the clandestine support of Latin American revolutionary and subversive activities related to Guatemala, “LEONOV was consistently active in clandestine support of Latin American revolutionary and subversive activities, particularly relating to Guatemala.”
summary: This file contains information on Nikolay Sergeyevich Leonov, a KGB officer active in supporting Latin American revolutionary activities, particularly in Guatemala, who later became Chief of Service No. 1 (Information) of KGB Headquarters First (Foreign Intelligence) Directorate in Moscow.
summary_one_paragraph: This file, reviewed by the House Select Committee on Assassinations staff members, details the activities of Nikolay Sergeyevich Leonov, a KGB officer born in the USSR in 1928. Leonov served in various roles at the Soviet Embassy in Mexico City from 1953 to 1968, during which time he was reportedly active in clandestine support of Latin American revolutionary and subversive activities, especially concerning Guatemala. Information within the file indicates that he attended KGB school from 1958 to 1960 and by 1976 had become Chief of Service No. 1 of the KGB Headquarters First Directorate in Moscow. The file includes a biographic profile of Leonov, travel records, and intelligence concerning his contacts and activities, including a reference to his possible identification as a KGB officer by a defector.
title: LEONOV, NIKOLAY SERGEYEVICH
